com.flipp.flyerkit

Class FlyerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.flipp.flyerkit.FlyerView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public final class FlyerView
extends android.view.ViewGroup
    A view that displays a scrollable, zoomable flyer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FlyerView.BadgeAnnotation
      An interface implemented for badge annotations.
      static interface  FlyerView.FlyerViewListener
      Interface definition for a callback handler to be invoked upon flyer view events.
      static interface  FlyerView.TapAnnotation
      An interface implemented for tap annotations.

      • FlyerView

        public FlyerView(android.content.Context context)
        Simple constructor to use when creating a view from code.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.

      • FlyerView

        public FlyerView(android.content.Context context,
                 android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
        Constructor that is called when inflating a view from XML. This is called when a view is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the Context's Theme and the given AttributeSet.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.

      • FlyerView

        public FlyerView(android.content.Context context,
                 android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                 int defStyleAttr)
        Constructor that is called when inflating a view from XML. This is called when a view is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the Context's Theme and the given AttributeSet.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute in the current theme that contains a reference to a style resource to apply to this view. If 0, no default style will be applied.

        public FlyerView.FlyerViewListener getFlyerViewListener()

        Returns:

      • setTapAnnotations

        public void setTapAnnotations(java.util.List<FlyerView.TapAnnotation> annotations)
        Assign a list of annotations to fire callback events on single tap, double tap and long press events.
        Parameters:
        annotations - A list of annotations to fire callback events, or null to remove all tap annotations.

      • getTapAnnotations

        public java.util.List<FlyerView.TapAnnotation> getTapAnnotations()
        Returns the current list of tap annotations.
        Returns:
        The current list of tap annotations, or null if there are no tap annotations.

      • setBadgeAnnotations

        public void setBadgeAnnotations(java.util.List<FlyerView.BadgeAnnotation> annotations)
        Assign a list of annotations to show as images on top of the flyer. The order of the annotations determines the order in which items are drawn. Annotations with a higher index/position are drawn last and on top of items with a lower index/position value.
        Parameters:
        annotations - A list of badges to show as images on top of the flyer.

      • getBadgeAnnotations

        public java.util.List<FlyerView.BadgeAnnotation> getBadgeAnnotations()
        Returns the current list of badge annotations.
        Returns:
        The current list of badge annotations, or null if none.

      • setHighlightAnnotations

        public void setHighlightAnnotations(java.util.List<android.graphics.RectF> annotations)
        Highlights a set of rectangles on the flyer.
        Parameters:
        annotations - A list of rectangles to be highlighted on the flyer view, or null to disable highlights.

      • getHighlightAnnotations

        public java.util.List<android.graphics.RectF> getHighlightAnnotations()
        Returns the current list of highlighted rectangles.
        Returns:
        The current list of highlighted rectangles, or null if highlights are disabled.

      • setFlyerId

        public void setFlyerId(int flyerId,
                       java.lang.String accessToken,
                       java.lang.String rootUrl,
                       java.lang.String apiVersion)
        Display the given flyer in the flyer view.
        Parameters:
        flyerId - The identifier of the flyer to show; obtained from the Flipp REST API.
        accessToken - The token for accessing the given flyer id.
        rootUrl - The root url of the api (ex. https://api.flipp.com/).
        apiVersion - The version of the api (ex. v2.0).

        The current visible rectangle in flyer coordinates.

      • getContentSize

        public android.graphics.PointF getContentSize()
        Returns the size of the flyer coordinate space.
        Returns:
        The size of the flyer coordinate space.

      • zoomToRect

        public void zoomToRect(android.graphics.RectF rect,
                       boolean animated)
        Zoom to the given rectangle in flyer coordinates, optionally animating.
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle to zoom to. The rectangle may be adjusted to keep it within flyer bounds.
        animated - True if the transition should be animated.
